About The Role

As a Data Analyst at Wesfarmers Health, your primary responsibility will be to deliver actionable, data-driven insights that inform business performance and improvement opportunities.

You will play a pivotal role in ensuring that our business operations are optimized, resulting in material customer and commercial benefits. This role is essential in maintaining Unified Data Models (UDMs), developing data-driven insights, fostering business engagement, and collaborating effectively within the team.

These responsibilities of the role
• Establish a deep understanding of data structure and definitions.
• Apply appropriate data linkages and logic to create and maintain central data models and metrics.
• Maintain a central knowledge repository on data models and definitions that are easily understood by technical and non-technical users.
• Identify, report, and resolve data anomalies and quality issues.
• Validate data analytics requirements based on a clear understanding of business objectives, opportunities, and challenges.
• Apply statistical, analytical, and visualization techniques to translate data into meaningful and relevant insights that meet business requirements.
• Validate and review data inputs, analytical methodologies, and outputs appropriately.
• Build positive business relationships to support business outcomes.
• Provide clear and relevant communications (both written and verbal) to explain analytical findings, recommendations, methodologies, and limitations.
• Consult with business stakeholders, with support from others, to capture, validate, and agree on business requirements before commencing analysis.
• Self-manage the delivery of your work based on the agreed scope, timeline, and deliverables.
• Communicate work progress, utilisation, dependencies, and blockers proactively to the team.

Our ideal candidate would have the following experience/attributes:
• 1 year+ experience in data analytics roles.
• Foundational knowledge of SQL and Business Intelligence (PowerBI or Looker).
• Proficiency with Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, LookerML, web analytics is desirable.
• Strong attention to detail and a sense of accuracy – able to independently identify and resolve data issues to produce reliable analysis.
• Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills with knowledge in data cleansing, profiling, visualization, statistical analysis/modelling.
• Commercially focused, able to translate data trends into meaningful and relevant insights.
• Excellent communicator (both verbally and written), capable of presenting complex concepts clearly and confidently.
• Able to self-manage, problem-solve independently, but also work well as a team player, quick and independent learner.

Education/Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Data Science.

We value our employees by offering:
• A fantastic work culture based off our four Ways of Working – Be well, Show You Care, Make it Better and Act Now
• Ongoing professional development and career opportunities across the Wesfarmers Health Division and the broader Wesfarmers Group
• Access to employee benefits across Wesfarmers including staff discounts at Bunnings, Kmart, Target, Officeworks, Priceline and Clear Skincare
• Access to Discounted Health Insurance

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions, have the required qualifications and skills, and are eager to join a dynamic team, we invite you to apply for this exciting Data Analyst role at Wesfarmers Health.

Full Professional Proficiency in English

Description

We are currently seeking a motivated and experienced Data Analyst on a permanent, full-time basis to review data to identify key insights, and solve problems and be able to communicate this information to various stakeholders across the organisation.

The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Key duties of the role include:
• Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
• Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimise statistical efficiency and quality.

• Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.

Desirable:
• Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques.

Hi! And thanks for stopping by!

We’re MYOB, a business management platform designed to unleash the potential of businesses across Australia and New Zealand! As the #originalstartup, our roots are in finance and accounting software, but today we are so much more. We help our Aussie and Kiwi customers unleash their full potential, giving them the tools to Start, Survive and Succeed: all in the one place.

We’re always on the hunt for those who bring a different perspective, diversity of thought and the drive to make our culture even better. Take your career to a new dimension at MYOB.

About the Team

Our Unified marketing team is here to drive un-believe-able results for the business. They create demand in market for MYOB and engage AU & NZ businesses when it matters most to either acquire or retain them. They’re dedicated to delivering value for our customers by understanding their business pain points, and needs and ensuring we deliver them value at every stage of their journey.

Are you passionate about utilising data to drive strategic marketing decisions? Do you have a curiosity for extracting insights from complex datasets and turning them into practical recommendations? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our marketing team as a Marketing Performance Analyst.

About the Role

As a Marketing Performance Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our marketing team by analysing data, tracking program performance, and providing strategic insights. Your focus will be on optimising channel effectiveness, enhancing marketing program outcomes, and contributing to the overall success of our marketing efforts. Reporting to the Marketing Analytics and Performance Manager, you will collaborate with various team members across the organisation, including marketing leaders, cross-functional teams, and external partners.

Key Responsibilities

- Conduct in-depth tactical data analysis across marketing channels, identifying areas for process improvement and implementing metrics from engagement to conversion across segments.

- Mine and analyse data from multiple sources to track the performance of marketing programs against key performance indicators, offering insights to drive optimisation.

- Monitor and analyse performance throughout the marketing and sales funnel, pinpointing opportunities for enhancement.

- Collaborate with marketing, sales, revenue operations, and finance teams to contribute to quarterly and annual forecasts and performance modelling.

- Develop and implement regular reporting and data visualisations to communicate insights to senior leaders, enhancing self-serve analytics across the marketing function.

- Stay up-to-date with the latest web analytics tools and technologies, making recommendations for new tools that can improve web performance monitoring.

About You

- Deep understanding of data analytics across multiple channels.

- Strong operational experience in systems, processes, and technologies.

- Profound understanding of B2B marketing and sales strategies.

- Proven experience in website analytics, preferably in e-commerce or digital marketing environments, with expertise in Google Analytics, including configuration and reporting.

- Proven experience with various data platforms and tools, including Google Analytics, Microsoft Power BI, CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce or HubSpot), Microsoft Excel, and SQL for data analysis.

- Ability to extract insights from extensive data volumes to inform customer acquisition and retention strategies.

- Prior experience in creating dashboards and reports to convey findings to diverse audiences.

- Familiarity with business databases and data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) is desirable.

Skills and Competencies

- Commercial savvy and business insight.

- Proficiency in data analysis and insights generation.

- Effective communication and collaboration skills.

- Passion for getting results through data-driven decisions.

- Ability to work successfully in a cross-functional team environment.

Our Culture & Benefits

Our values have stood the test of time. If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued, and your ideas can make a difference, come to a place where Your Work Matters.

   See what it's like to work at MYOB and what we're all about.

   Do your best work in a flexible work environment, right down to financial assistance to set up your home office…it’s called Flexperience, and it’s designed by you and your team!

   Our partnership with Smiling Mind helps support the wellbeing of our team members and customers

   Drive your own learning via conferences, in-house training, LinkedIn Learning, study assistance and a strong focus on leaders creating a learning environment

   A multitude of leave options including up to an additional four weeks of purchased leave, generous parental leave, domestic violence leave, transgender leave, volunteer leave, study leave, plus more!

   Communities built around ‘Wellness’, ‘Belonging’ and the ‘Planet’ where you can make a meaningful contribution

   Access to best-in-class discounts and vouchers from leading retailers, and a lot more.

We are proud to be a Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to responding to every applicant.

MYOB are an equal opportunity employer and we champion diversity. Don’t meet every single requirement of this role? Still apply! Research tells us that that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply unless they meet every single requirement. At MYOB we believe that the right hire is someone who makes an addition to our culture, rather than someone who fits in and conforms to our status quo. Moving to ‘Culture Add’ means adding team members who not only value MYOBs standards and workplace culture, but also bring an aspect of diversity that positively contributes to MYOB. So, if you’re excited about this role, or about MYOB, we’d still love to hear from you!

The purpose of Customer Insights and Reporting team is to support the entire OnePass business by enabling more sophisticated uses of data across OnePass and our partnering Divisions. This team is responsible for establishing a self-service reporting capability within the business, for designing, building and maintaining reports to support management and operational decision making, and for responding to ad-hoc analysis needs. This team is also responsible for designing advanced analytical solutions to business or customer problems and working with domain teams to deploy these solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting complex data sets to extract valuable insights and drive data-informed decision-making. Your expertise in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and data visualisation will contribute to the success of OnePass by identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven initiatives and deliver actionable recommendations. The ideal candidate is passionate about data, possesses strong analytical skills, and is comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment.

Key Duties And Deliverables
• Acquire and cleanse large and diverse data sets from various sources to ensure data integrity and quality.
• Apply statistical techniques and data mining methods to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
• Conduct exploratory data analysis and identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
• Create clear and concise visualisations, dashboards, and reports to present data-driven insights to stakeholders.
• Develop interactive dashboards using data visualisation tools to facilitate understanding and exploration of data.
• Collaborate with team members to create automated reports and streamline data analysis processes.
• Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the effectiveness of business processes and strategies.
• Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations based on data analysis findings.
• Work closely with stakeholders to define and track performance metrics aligned with business objectives.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data requirements and provide analytical support.
• Translate complex data findings into actionable insights and recommendations.
• Contribute to strategic planning by leveraging data insights to identify business opportunities and risks.
• Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with data governance policies.
• Develop and implement data validation procedures to identify and resolve data quality issues.
• Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in data analytics and data management.

Key Relationships

Reports To

Reporting and Analytics Lead

What you will need
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
• Proven work experience as a Data Analyst or similar role in a product-driven organization (3+ years)
• Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data querying from databases.
• Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

Senior Business Data Analyst – Banking Risk practice

Technology is at the core of any successful #digitaltransformation and Minds are helping the world's leading companies enable and continuously differentiate themselves with next-gen technologies, and hyperscale #cloud-native services to maximize growth and deliver business value. Client's professional services have a proven model of agile development that delivers high value applications in months not years and can efficiently transfer working solutions and knowledge to our customer thru well-structured training programs.

We are working with large banking customers managing their risk data programs that are focused on transforming risk related reporting by leveraging Cloud Data frameworks, modern technology and human centric design / service design principles.

Program is ramping up its need of Sr. Business and Data Analyst to drive long-term business user change in self-service consumption of the risk reports. The end objective is to rebuild a number of current reports that exist today relating to risk reporting on cloud data platform. Typically, this will involve looking at the end report as it exists today, look at where the Data is coming from, trace its sources, map out the calculations, transformations and ensure that the future state risk reporting is transformed from where it is today.

Experience and skills required
• Mid/senior level experience in IT software project delivery or business / tech roles
• 5+ years experience as an Agile project BA / Sr. BA

• Some familiarity with Data analysis, particularly running basic SQL query to check the data source and mapping of where the data is coming from is required
• Excellent written and verbal skills - the BAs and Data analysts will heavily be engaged in business meetings, facilitation / elicitation workshops and needing to change manage or influence business to think newer ways of risk reporting
• Excellent ability to document analysis of reporting and its underlying layers for ex: excel or word documents that show the history of where data is being sourced and where it is originating etc. Further fine tune these documents with inputs from a variety of stakeholders
• A go-getter, curious and analytically minded analyst who does not mind questioning the status quo and understands how to position constructive point of views without making it a conflict
• Strong work ethics, self-initiated - someone who is not waiting for the instructions to delivery value

As a strong technologist, you will focus on the platforms, data pipelines, engineering and data science tooling, and have sound data management practices. As a data professional you are invested in improving processes to ensure stakeholders have low friction and high value access to data.

You will have/be:

Want to find a Data Science Role?Or are you thinking even bigger? With our program, you will have the opportunity to work with Australian companies.
Are you looking to start your career in the field of your studies or even something bigger?

Our Professional Internship Program is a structured program run by qualified staff that offers students a career readiness program, industry mentor, and an internship in a professional environment.
Upon completion of the program, you will be eligible to undertake an internship placement relevant to your field of study.

About our host companies:

Our host companies are well established in Australian businesses. They offer a supportive learning environment that pays particular attention to learner's needs.
They deliver bespoke, practical and fact-based solutions for the clients by combining proprietary tools and techniques to quickly bring transparency to organisational effectiveness, with experienced teams of rigorous, creative and pragmatic consultants.

Learning Opportunities:

Some of the activities you could expect part of your intern role include:
• Performing research and data sourcing
• Data analysis
• Data visualisations
• Data modelling (subject to the level of knowledge and understanding)
• Data wrangling
Please note: Responsibilities and detailed projects will be determined based on your educational background, interests, and skills.

All activities will be under the host company’s supervision.

To register for the Program, you must be:
• Currently studying or recently completed relevant into the IT/ Data Analyst/ Engineering Science field is a MUST
• Able to demonstrate English language proficiency or be a native speaker
• Knowledge on R, Python, SQL Programming language (through studies)
• Knowledge of data wrangling (exposure with data in CSV and other formats)
• Understanding of basic statistical methods for data analytics
About Eightfold Institute of Australia:

Eightfold Institute of Australia is a nationally recognised training organisation - RTO Code 22577 dedicated to helping students and graduates to develop their knowledge, skills and abilities by providing Professional Development and Internship Programs. We provide you with actual industry experience in your profession and the skills to help you succeed in your career.

Our focus is to ensure the program maximises your work-integrated learning experience. Fees apply for the program. Throughout the program, you will strengthen your employment prospects, improve your work readiness and general skills to help you toward future employment opportunities. Register your interest with our Professional Development and Internship Program.

There is no better place to show what you’re made of – apply now!

Job description:

Join us and let’s make a bigger difference together.

It’s an exciting time to be joining Australian Unity – we have grown significantly over recent years and are transforming to capitalise on further growth opportunities to help our customers and employees thrive. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value. Australian Unity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company. Today we have over $1 billion in revenue and provide smart solutions and services to more than 700,000 Australians. We employ over 7000 people and our purpose is to Help People to Thrive.

Your New Role:

This role reports directly to the Head of Data Governance, Customer, Digital and Technology. The Data Steward will be required to work with business operational platforms and enabling units to undertake a groupwide data mapping exercise to assess privacy and security risks. The Data Steward is responsible for instilling data governance cohesion within and across these business functions.

The scope of work requires strong stakeholder engagement skills to facilitate workshops and ensure business requirements are met. With excellent attention to detail, the successful candidate will need to be a self-starter, thrive in a fast-paced work environment and be able to utilise their skill set to help guide and support the business on delivering better solutions. This is a great opportunity to work with stakeholders across a variety of business domains on data governance initiatives.
• Collaborate with Technology, Data and Digital Executive Committee (TDDEC) members to receive, understand and drive policy directives and mandates.
• Collaborate with data stewards in interpreting policy requirements, uplifting relevant information governance policies, standards, and processes, for subsequent TDDEC submission and approval.
• Assist in consolidated reporting into the TDDEC, with responsibility for driving the collation of team metrics, spanning across data domains and business functions of the enterprise.
• Improve maturity of data governance in the range of stewardship activities and responsibilities.
• Improve the data quality remediation framework and resolve data quality issues with operational business leads.
• Responsibility for collation of information governance tooling requirements covering core capabilities of the Information Governance Framework (IGF).
• Builds and manages stakeholder (internal and external) relationships. Relationships with stakeholders including Data SMEs, Business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members and management leaders.

About You:
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in Data Governance, Data Architecture and Enterprise Data Life Cycle Management is a must.
• Knowledge of information governance policies, standards and principles, in the context of access, usage, storage and disposal of data.
• Awareness of the security, privacy and quality requirements for critical data domains and entities
• Experience with data analysis techniques
• Deep and comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives
• Visibility with and respect from all levels of the organization — stewards must have credibility and a track record of success in the business
• Demonstrated knowledge of industry leading data quality and data management practices with comprehensive knowledge of DMBOK framework and other information governance frameworks

Your Benefits:

You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:
• Competitive Remuneration and Incentive Program
• A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity’s Retail and Wealth Management portfolio – including health insurance and banking products
• Supported Learning and Career Development program
• Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance
• Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform
• Additional paid Wellbeing and Community Volunteer Days yearly

What Makes Us, Us

Putting people first is not just something we say, it's what we do. We care for our people so they can care for themselves and our customers. We stay true to our values (Bold, Warm, Honest), we work hard because it matters and we work well together – collaborating, encouraging and even managing to have some fun.

At Australian Unity we do the right thing and we expect the same from others. Being a member-owned company, means we're focused on our members and customers, not shareholder returns. Our purpose to Help People to Thrive, drives us to make a real difference, every day, big and small. We are passionate about improving the wellbeing of all Australians and about making a positive difference.

Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.

About Bupa Asia Pacific
From aged care homes receptionists, dental surgeons, telehealth and admin, to our call centres, data professionals and tech gurus, we’re all in it together – 22,000+ people who keep inspiring each other to explore new possibilities, wherever the challenges of the healthcare world take us.
Where are we heading?

We set a global ambition to be the world's most customer-centric healthcare company, and are committed to excellent customer experiences through service, value, and putting our customer at the heart of everything we do. Care is at our core and will always be a part of how we operate.
More than that, our care puts customers at the heart of everything we do. We make a genuine effort to see the world through our customers’ eyes to make things easy, keep relevant to their needs and showing empathy and understanding.

About the role:
Reporting to the Senior Channel Insights Manager, the Senior Channel Insights Analyst will leverage their natural curiosity and interest in channel processes and customer insights to help develop an understanding of our customer journey. With a passion for customer advocacy and storytelling through data, they will uncover actionable insights using unstructured and structured data analysis techniques.

This will be achieved through a combination of data collation from available sources, data synthesis using available tools and a comprehensive understanding of operational efficiencies, Bupa’s internal processes and the broader Health Insurance (HI) market. The successful candidate will be instrumental in engaging with key advocacy business partners and Customer and Business Operations (CBO) management to arrive at actionable insights and recommendations.

How will I help?

Key accountabilities of this role include:
• Developing insights articulating business impact for critical Quarterly reporting, highlighting causes of customer friction and performance of Internally Escalated / PHIO complaints against market share.
• Be the subject-matter-expert and conduit between data and business impact (primarily across the end-to-end complaints journey / process), with the ability to align insights to specific business objectives.
• Synthesise unstructured business problems into meaningful recommendations across operational metrics and strategic drivers, including identifying interrelationships and highlighting implications.
• Engage and collaborate with stakeholders across CBO and HI to evaluate strategy and share data and insights addressing customer (complaints) experience feedback.
• Maintain a suite of PowerBI dashboards to support the regulatory and adhoc cycle of complaints reporting, translating data into easy-to-understand reports and dashboards designed to support business leaders with channel operations.
• Continuous improvement of how reports are served, utilising existing technologies and data structures whilst also exploring the art of the possible.
• Work closely with business and technical teams to ensure optimal utilisation of available resources and impending technologies – ensure our requirements are proactively addressed and onboarded as we transition to newer data architectures.
• Other adhoc work as required for Customer & Business Operations leadership

What do I need?
• Relevant Business qualification (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Science, IT, Management, etc.).
• 3+ years external / internal business advisory, or management consulting experience
• Proven ability to analyse data and present granular or technical data in an effective and reliable manner.
• Ability to quickly understand business processes, systems, opportunities and limitations
• Manages time effectively to meet competing deadlines and milestones
• Works productively in a pressurised environment, keeping emotions under control during difficult situations and balances the demands of work by maintaining a positive outlook at work.
• Experience in identifying, quantifying and articulating business improvement opportunities
• Excellent written and oral communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence senior leaders with best-in-class data storytelling out of disparate data and information sources.
• Ability to build strong advisory relationships with senior stakeholders, as well as seamless engagement and collaboration across the organisational structure.
• Capability of working with a high degree of complexity and ambiguity, whilst delivering rapid, accurate and impactful results.
• Power to influence based on clearly articulated recommendations and concisely represented data that drives stakeholder expectations to the point of decision-making.
• Experience working with contact centre operations or other customer facing environments is preferable
• Ability to manoeuvre SAS and SQL databases will be considered as a positive.

Why work at Bupa?
• We keep our people smiling by helping them improve their lives in and outside of the office.
• We’re a welcoming lot, no matter who you are or where you’ve come from. We welcome all talents and backgrounds and embrace our differences, so you can bring your true self to work.
• We support our people to be the best version of themselves, physically and mentally. With a healthy work/life balance, leadership support, reduced private health cover, study leave, volunteering options and a commitment to promoting from within.
• Our employees can access wide range of benefits: from our own products (incl. health insurance discounts) to many other products and services via our partnerships program (like Apple, Samsung, JB Hi-Fi, plus gym and spa discounts to name a few).
• We reward our people and celebrate their success, provide initiatives that develop careers and look after our people’s health, wellbeing and futures.
• *Please note that selection processes will commence immediately, and late application may result in exclusion from the process.**

At Melbourne Water we love water and love life. What we do makes a vital contribution to Melbourne's famous lifestyle.

We achieve this by supplying high quality drinking water, providing outstanding sewerage services, integrating drainage systems, building resilience to flooding and by enhancing our waterway and land for greater community use.
At Melbourne Water we are in the 'Decade that Matters' and we've got some ambitious goals to achieve. It's a pride we share in helping to make greater Melbourne a fantastic place to live.

The RoleReporting to the Manager, Data Management this role is responsible for designing, constructing and maintaining our data pipelines, ensuring the seamless flow of data in our data warehouse environments.

By collaborating closely with our stakeholders, your work will empower data-driven decision making and enhance our data analysis and reporting capabilities.
Some of the day to day duties will include:
Lead the implementation and management of scalable data pipelines, ETL processes and data integration solutions
Work closely with stakeholders, data analytics, business intelligence and governance teams to identify and deliver user cases, user demands and enhanced data platform capabilities
Monitor and address data pipeline failures and conducting complex troubleshooting to maintain data availability, security and quality

Your Skills and ExperienceOur successful candidate must have a Tertiary degree in Information/Data Management, Data Science, Computer Science, or a relevant information technology area.

They must bring to the role the following:
Demonstrated experience in data engineering disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimisation and data quality, etc.
Experience in APIs, ETL and building and optimizing 'big data' pipelines and data sets
Programming in SQL including development, testing and implementation
Experience with big data tools (such as Hadoop, Spark) and data analytics and programming tools such as Power Query, SQL, Python/R, and DAX
Experience using cloud computing and storage platforms e.g. AWS EC2, Azure Data Factory, S3/Blob Storage, Azure SQL DB, Logic Apps, Power BI,

Experience working with and integrating modern Data Analytics/ Data Science tools, such as Power BI Desktop and Power BI Report Server.
We take enormous pride in cultivating a culture that holistically benefits our team and the wider Melbourne community. The pillars of our culture are based onFlexibility, Impact, Growth & Development,andPeople.

We are committed to flexible working in a variety of manners including hybrid work, varied start/finish times, purchased leave, part time work, and 9 day fortnights.
We understand that Melbourne Water and our customers are benefitted by enabling balance in work and life.
Make an impact as part of a passionate team doing meaningful work to enhance life and liveability in Melbourne.
We relish learning and challenging the status quo for continuous growth.

Perpetual and varied opportunities for learning and development are offered in a variety of manners - from formal development programs, digital learning content and lunch & learns; to visiting our sites and getting to see our initiatives and projects first hand.
People are the foundation for all that we do. Our people are warm, welcoming, and inclusive.

We welcome applications from everyone, including people with disability, mature age and young job seekers, members of the LGBTI+ community, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.
Melbourne Water welcomes and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Our vision is to be the best operator of a portable entitlements scheme with the purpose of supporting both the long-term wellbeing of construction workers and the vitality of the construction industry. We put members at the center of everything we do and operate a best practice model administering the Long Service Leave Scheme for the Construction Industry in Victoria.

At LeavePlus We Are Led By Our Values
• Here for our Members
• Empower our People.
• Thrive Together
• Anticipate and Create
With a significant transformation underway and due to our commitment to employee engagement and insights during this positive change we are looking to engage a talented Data & Analytics Manager.

This new role is a Permanent, Full time and Hybrid opportunity working from home and from our East Melbourne office, closely located to Parliament Station.

The Role

Our Data & Analytics Manager is responsible for driving value add insights across LeavePlus. You will support and instruct Leadership, Executive and Board level interaction with a view to enrich our view of the member. who is at the centre of everything we do, by utilising and building out the required data to derive valuable industry insights.

As an individual passionate about data quality, operational excellence and supporting digital innovation you will:
• Build and lead an agile Data and Analytics team that supports our internal data owners, custodians and consumers of data.
• Manage the strategy and execution of LeavePlus’s Data and Analytics Roadmap.
• Drive data as an asset and identify opportunities for data to be utilised to achieve business outcomes.
• Establish data governance standards and practices to provide responsible data management.
• Support organisational uplift through access to accurate data insights facilitating the provision of a self-serve capability.
• Establish and operate reporting, data visualisation, predictive modelling, geospatial analytics, prescriptive modelling and advanced analytics.
• Manage the data lifecycle, generating insights through a comprehensive data product using data engineering, automation, data science, AI/ML, housing, and suite of tooling and platforms.
• Provide strategic support and oversight to stakeholders including the Executive and Leadership teams to enable proactive strategic, operational and tactical decision making.
• Set and manage Data Management Policy and its tactical implementation across the organisation.
As a business that demonstrates a true commitment to its employees CoINVEST is committed to providing:
• An attractive and competitive base salary.
• 12% Superannuation
• Training and Career Development support.
• Established Health & Wellbeing Program.
• Member centric culture that nurtures diversity.
Who are you?

As a strong leader with 5+ years corporate experience in the Data and Analytics domain, preferably with financial services experience, you will possess a proven understanding of data governance and best practices in relation to privacy, data handling, data security, regulatory and standards-based compliance you will enjoy working within a culture who values are 'Empower our People, Thrive Together, Anticipating & Create and Here for our Member.'

Simply click APPLY, provide your resume and a compelling cover letter and we’ll be in touch. If you’d like to discuss further, then contact our team at LeavePlus on 03 9664 7667.

Employment at LeavePlus is conditional upon the satisfactory completion of a National Police Check. Applications are open to those with full working rights in Australia. LeavePlus is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. LeavePlus is committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its employees and members. Currently all LeavePlus employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to work on-site.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who can build the solution from functional specs. You will be responsible for the design, development, implementation, management and support of the critical enterprise BI reporting, ETL processes and environments.

Core Technical Skills Required
• Understanding of BI technology trends and issues, extensive use of Power BI and SSRS
• Experience in database administration and data warehousing
• Solid background in SQL development/support (SQL server, TSQL, SSIS)

Skills & Attributes:
• Has demonstrated a proven pragmatic and agile approach to managing initiatives ensuring high availability at the most appropriate costs
• Organised, focused and methodical; able to multitask
• High Level of accuracy whilst maintain efficient use of time.
• Strong problem solving and analytical skills with high attention to detail
• Strong time management and multitasking skills.
• Ability to work autonomously
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to build lasting client relationships
• Willingness and proven ability to learn new technologies and processes

If this sounds like you, or someone you know, do not hesitate to Apply NOW...

Please note you must have full Aussie work rights and be willing to work in the Melbourne office.

Location: Melbourne

Mode of Hire: Permanent

• Proven experience working as a business analyst.

Synechron, is a global provider of Information Technology outsourcing services focused on the banking, finance and payments industry. We provide a broad range of IT services and technology solutions that are flexible, cost-effective, efficient and reliable. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver high quality resources and solutions to our clients. Through Synechron’s Financial innovation labs, we continue to develop innovative solutions by providing engineering payment solutions, creating tools and processes that shape the evolution of technology.

This high profile government body is currently seeking a Data Engineering & Architecture Lead to support current initiatives and help design target state data architecture, strategy, and integration for a key Program of work.

To secure this newly created role you will have a background in Data Engineering and Architecture at a leadership level, with extensive experience in complex legacy architecture where you have assisted the company in modernising this through Data Transformation i.e.: transformation from legacy systems to modern i.e.: CRM etc.

Key activities
• Lead the production of domain specific architecture material (both for current and target state) such as models, designs, patterns, and solutions and ensure it is consistent and complimentary to other architecture domains
• Develop architecture documentation for initiatives/projects focusing on the data domain
• Maintain oversight and signoff on intermediate and detailed design and changes to existing solution data architecture as required
• Deliver and discuss domain architecture, solution architectures and recommendations to stakeholders
• Create and capture accurate and complete records of the business activities related to this position, in accordance with approved policy and procedures
• Development of target state data architectures and data models for complex systems (conceptual, logical and physical), including legacy to modern stack

Skills, knowledge and experience
• Extensive demonstrated experience in setting and managing enterprise data projects and standards, including data engineering and analytics experience
• Deep expertise in Big Data/ Analytics systems, specifications, and solution architectures
• Experience designing and implementing high-performing data/analytics solutions with both traditional and model data warehousing and Big Data technologies
• Strong communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders
• Experience in creating and embedding data governance
• Broad experience and understanding across:
• Data and information management in context of analytics and reporting
• Data migration and transformation (ETL, ELT, including on-prem to cloud)
• Analytical software and languages e.g. SAS, R, Python
• Traditional database and emerging technologies e.g. SQL, DB2, OLAP/dimensional, NoSQL, non-structured data etc.
• Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Oracle Cloud)

Apply now to secure an interview or contact Josh D'Monte on 9236 7723 for a confidential discussion.

What's in it for you?

Do you want to expand your skills? Feel like you can offer more to your current business? Feel as though your skills are not being utilised? Do you also enjoy fraud prevention and payments? And data? And writing reports?...
#J-18808-Ljbffr

At XY Sense, we're revolutionizing the way businesses understand and optimize their space utilization and occupancy data. Our cutting-edge technology empowers organizations to make data-driven decisions that enhance productivity, reduce costs, and create more efficient spaces. We're looking for a Data Engineer with expertise in Snowflake and Looker to help us scale, maintain data integrity, and provide actionable insights to our customers.

Who are we looking for?

We’re looking for a Junior to Mid-Level Data Engineer to join our data team to continue scaling the development of our customer facing analytics offering. Ultimately your mission is to empower the world’s best companies to create workplaces people love using data informed occupancy insights.

In this role you will play a critical role as a dedicated technical expert leading our data analytics platform to maintain stability and deliver on roadmap and customer analytics needs.

Key Responsibilities

Data Infrastructure and Architecture:
• Contribute to the architecture and optimization of our data infrastructure in Snowflake and Looker.
• Develop strategies to ensure the scalability, integrity, and functionality of our data domain.
• Implement data warehousing best practices, including data partitioning, clustering, and indexing, to optimize query performance.

Data Pipelines and ETL:
• Design, build, and maintain ETL data pipelines in Snowflake using SQL to support meaningful insights.
• Enable data-driven decision-making in the domains of occupancy and space utilization.

Looker Dashboard Development:
• Build and maintain Looker dashboards, reports, and data exploration tools to deliver fast and stable customer dashboards.
• Write LookML for defining data models and exploring dimensions, measures, and calculated fields.

Customer-Centric Collaboration:
• Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to translate customer needs into technical requirements and dashboard designs.
• Provide support for data-related issues and incidents, including customer support requests.
• Investigate and resolve data discrepancies and anomalies to ensure data accuracy.

Organisational contribution:
• Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, data models, and transformation processes.
• Foster knowledge sharing and best practices adherence within cross-functional teams.
• Be a great human, self-motivated and eager to support the continual expansion and global success of XY Sense.

What do you need to succeed in this role
• Experience leading Data projects and initiatives or at least 5 years of top performance in a data & analytics team.
• Strong proficiency in SQL (2+ years of experience).
• Proficiency with a BI tool (Looker preferred) - Building views, defining LookML, running queries, building dashboards.
• Good understanding of working with Data Pipelines and ETL processes (Snowflake experience preferred).
• Comfort working directly in the codebase as it relates to data processing.
• Proficiency in Python.
• Knowledge of statistics and applying business rules to data for real-world applications.
• Experience working in a cloud environment, ideally AWS.
• Demonstrated experience in making analytical, data-driven decisions.
• Excellent communication skills for conveying technical concepts and calculations to business stakeholders.

What we will offer in return

We’re offering a competitive remuneration package aligned to your experience. We’re growing fast, so you can also expect an attractive ESOP package and a lot of upside (permanent employees only). But beyond the dollars, you can expect a team with a can-do attitude who don’t take themselves too seriously but take pride in their work and genuinely care for each other.

At XY Sense, each of us takes a direct role in making an impact for the business and our customers, and we are huge supporters of individual growth and maintaining a balanced life outside of work. Our workplace policy is Hybrid for those based in Melbourne (and designed by teams themselves). Many of our team members are also working remotely with success in both interstate and international locations.

If this sounds like a team you’d love to be a part of and would like to take a leading impact role within, we’d love to talk.

data.employer_name: St John of God Health Care
data.job_description:
Welcome to St John of God Health Care

St John of God Health Care is one of the largest private providers of health care services in Australia, employing more than 16,000 employees (caregivers). We operate 27 hospitals and services comprising more than 3,500 hospital beds, including home nursing, disability services and social outreach programs.

With over 127 years' experience in health care, we have an excellent reputation as a caring, nurturing and supportive employer. Learning is highly valued and there are many opportunities for professional development.

We are in the process of restructuring our Analytics and Data reporting services. To support the coming changes, we have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist - Clinical to join us on this innovative journey and oversee all aspects of clinical data analysis and interpretation.

The Senior Data Scientist will be a senior partner in the Analytics team and will deliver data science and analytics solutions by using a spectrum of analytical techniques from descriptive and diagnostic outputs to machine learning models and AI adoption. The Senior Data Scientist will explore new methodologies, predict trends and derive meaningful insights to drive positive outcomes for patients, caregivers and the organization.

This position is on a Permanent Full time basis, working 76 hours a fortnight.

The successful candidate will have:
• A willingness and capacity to embrace the Mission and Values of St John of God Health Care.
• Degree qualification in a Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.
• Understanding of healthcare terminology, processes, and data sources, including clinical systems, private healthcare claims data and Australian Healthcare funding models.
• Strong skills in programming languages commonly used for data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL.
• Knowledge of tools like Excel, Tableau, Power BI, or other data visualization platforms.
• Expertise in the application of machine learning algorithms, techniques, and libraries.
• Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including experience with statistical analysis, data visualization, and data mining to extract insights from complex healthcare datasets.
• Experience with data manipulation, pre-processing, and feature engineering for machine learning model building.
• Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
• Excellent communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
• Understanding of database concepts and data warehousing principles.

Desirable
• Knowledge of the private healthcare sector, business processes and resultant information needs.
• Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
• Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
• Be familiar with health data standards such as FHIR and HL7.

We Can Offer You:
• Highly competitive salary and conditions
• Salary packaging up to $18,550 on a range of benefits such as mortgage, rent, meal entertainment, holiday accommodation or other everyday living expenses as well as options to salary package benefits above the FBT cap on items such as:
• Novated leasing
• work related expenses
• self-education and
• additional superannuation
• Flexible work options – working from home arrangements
• A welcoming and supportive culture
• Access to a range of Lifestyle, Health & Wellbeing rewards & discounts
• Employee support through our dedicated free Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
• Close to public transport in a central CBD location

All applicants must address the Selection Criteria (as detailed on the last page of the Position Description) available via this link > Senior Data Scientist, Group Services.pdf

St John of God Health Care embraces diversity and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people with disabilities. We are committed to providing a safe environment for all children and vulnerable people in our care and proactively take measures to protect children/vulnerable people from abuse.

For enquiries, please contact Emily Ryder, Chief Analytics Officer on 0429 466 707.

Applications Close: 20/10/2023

Company Profile

The Data Scientist Intern will work with the Data Platform team to research and develop cloud-based data management solutions for our Systems. You will utilize a variety of technologies to provide a scalable, reliable foundation for organizations to store, process, and analyze large volumes of data.

In this role, you will:
• Learn to design and build data pipelines for common business use cases
• Develop and maintain data processing workflows
• Design and develop data visualizations
• Learn and apply machine learning techniques to data analysis
• Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement
• Research and implement best practices for data governance and security
• Contribute to documentation and knowledge sharing activities to ensure that the team's work is well documented and accessible to others

Working in our Forward Deployed stream, you will focus on scaling our model to new data frontiers. Your day to day involves feature engineering & scaling our model across multiple verticals and internationally.

We're using TimeSeries, Media Mix Modelling (MMM) and Bayesian techniques - you're not going to be building dashboards and running reports here.

Mutinex is a growing SaaS Startup that has found strong product Market fit, helping Marketers make better decisions.

We've grown from 20 to nearly 50 people over the past 12 months with hybrid working in Sydney or Melbourne.

The role

The key and core to the role is your ability to scale up state of the art modelling stacks, working at the cutting edge of delivering rapid model refreshes, workflows and world-class domains.

Your day to day will consist of:
• Build & deploy a state of the art model to solve key customer business challenges with complex Bayesian simulations
• Use high quality Feature Engineering and EDA skillsets, with a nose for understanding the fundamental pattern of data, to service high quality signal rapidly
• Drive continuous improvement of our MMM workflow and modelling process
• Work with some of the most interesting, diverse datasets across a huge range of real-world datasets.

What will the first 30-90 days look like

Start by settling into your new company, team and role and learn how our model works, who our customers are, and our ways of working. You will quickly ramp up by jumping into forward-deployed workstreams, applying our model on real world data and upskilling on our state of the art methods through practice.

After about 30 days you will be able to own multiple applications of the model autonomously.

After 60 days you will be able to run customers model onboardings end-to-end, from feature engineering to model calibration.

From 90 days on you will be contributing workflow improvements and driving automation of onboardings for new industries.

How success will be measured in this role:
• Model refresh speed and how you’re able to scale your refresh capacity
• Ability to create high quality signals for feature engineering
• Ability to problem solve to ensure a strong, causal model foundations
• Your ability to challenge the team to deliver causal inference within domains and push the team to really deeply understand new domains

What we are looking for:

We are looking for Mid level Data Scientists with:
• At least 1 year of experience in Data Science roles with either Time series, Bayesian or Media Mixed Modelling (MMM) experience. If you have all 3 then we're very keen to chat!
• Bachelors Degree or higher in Stats/Maths and/or Computer Science
• People who don’t believe frequentist techniques are achievable in the real-world

Commercial experience with the following technologies:
• Hands on coding in Python (Pandas, Numpy and open-source modelling libraries such as Scikit-Learn, XGBoost or Statsmodels) exploring and manipulating data, engineering new features and building and optimising model workflows to solve business problems;
• SQL to extract and explore data from a data warehouse;
• Comfortable with git
• Dagster/Airflow experience is a bonus.

About Mutinex

We might be an early stage startup but we already have strong product market fit, household name clients (Samsung, Mars, CUB and ING to name a few) and millions in revenue.

Being early stage means we're also still pretty scrappy and you wouldn't be coming into a well oiled machine, yet. But you would get a lot of opportunity to design, build and oil the machine until it's super oily.

We aren't aiming to be another Tech Unicorn because Unicorns aren't real. We are aiming (and confident of being) more like a real and really big animal that lives for a long time, like a Bowhead Whale.

Equity is on offer on top of base salary and super with amazing growth potential and more benefits to come as we build out our offering.

Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.

Founded in Australia and with recent seed capital ($5 million, backed by EVP) we are growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.

We have a hybrid work environment with no set or minimum days in the office and with teams in Sydney, Melbourne and expanding into the US.

With a team of around 45 people we value high quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.

Catholic Education Commission of Victoria
About Catholic Education Commission of Victoria (CECV)
CECV is the peak body for Catholic education in Victoria.

Established in 1973 by the Archbishop of Melbourne and the Bishops of the Ballarat, Sale, and Sandhurst dioceses, it was incorporated in 2006 and acts as the voice of Catholic education in State and national matters.

CECV receives and distributes funding from state and federal governments for Catholic schools, provides strategic leadership and planning, and ensures proper governance in Catholic education statewide.

It is responsible for sector leadership in education integrity and governance and has a Memorandum of Understanding to act as a Review Body for Catholic schools with the Victorian Registration and Qualifications Authority (VRQA).

As a Review Body, CECV supports, reviews, and monitors the compliance of Catholic schools with all registration, reporting and other requirements under relevant laws.

CECV is currently engaged in a significant organisational redesign, the overriding objective of which is to establish a robust and sustainable CECV for the future.
Why work with us

As the peak body for Catholic education in Victoria, CECV provides employees an opportunity to help shape the future of Catholic education across the state.

The renewed CECV will offer flexible working, a central city office location, competitive remuneration with generous benefits (including salary sacrifice options), and opportunities for career development and progression.
These benefits combine with our commitment to work life balance to make CECV an employer of choice.
About the role

The Research, Policy and Performance Excellence team undertakes a range of functions in support of the CECV's strategic leadership role.

It analyses data on school and system performance, oversees or undertakes strategic research, coordinates policy development and submissions to government and regulatory agencies, and leads other strategic initiatives to shape the direction of Catholic education in Victoria.

The Senior Analyst, Research, will play a critical role within the team by reviewing, performing or overseeing research into a wide range of issues relating to school performance, enrolments, education policies, strategic planning and school funding.
Key responsibilities of the role
Help determine research priorities for the CECV, in consultation with key stakeholders.

Lead research related to school performance, enrolments, education policy, strategic planning and/or school funding to support performance improvement, manage strategic risks and/or inform advocacy.

Engage and manage third parties to undertake research for the CECV (where relevant), managing scope, budget and project risks and delivery.

Monitor latest research and trends in the education sector, and proactively apply this knowledge to identify issues and potential future research, inform decision-making and drive innovation within CECV.

Provide expert advice and briefings to senior management, other stakeholders within Catholic education, and other organisations on a range of Catholic education matters and issues.

Gather data and analyse trends, conduct surveys, and monitor the performance of CECV's programs and initiatives to identify areas for improvement.
Prepare high-quality reports, briefings, and presentations to communicate research findings and recommendations.
Support the Manager, Research, Policy and Performance Excellence and Chief Strategy Officer with relevant projects.
Key selection criteria
Demonstrated experience in leading and conducting strategic research, data analysis and/or performance assessment, preferably in the education sector.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to collect, interpret and report data, conduct research, and provide evidence-based insights and recommendations.

Strong project management skills with the ability to oversee multiple projects, set priorities, and deliver results within established timelines and budget constraints.
Demonstrated high-level organisational skills, attention to detail, and a strong ability to plan workflow and manage deadlines.
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to present complex information in a clear and compelling manner.
Skills, qualifications, and pre-requisites
Relevant tertiary qualifications.
A minimum of three years' experience in a role involving research or data analysis, preferably within the education sector.
Shortlisting for this position will commence immediately. We encourage you to apply promptly as the advertisement may close early should a suitable applicant be sourced.

ONLY AUS PR/CITIZENS WILL BE CONSIDERED.

Australian Citizens residing in Australia only respond.
• Contract start 16 October 2023 to 12 months.
• Australian Citizen, Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, Melbourne, Perth role.

Send your responses to jobs@softtestpays.com

Overview

The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is responsible for the delivery of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). Since it was established, the NDIA has pursued a vision of optimising social and economic independence and full participation for people with disability. The Data & Analytics Branch supports the Agency by providing high quality data and reporting and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions.

Key Responsibilities
• Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the organisation. Capture business requirements and identify underlying business needs.
• Carry out analysis of present approaches and identify opportunities to enhance processes current and target state.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business requirements.
• Translate subject-matter expert and stakeholder discussion into process flows, procedures and business requirements.
• Identify and document instances where existing business processes may be streamlined or improved or do not meet current or potential future business needs.
• Develop, maintain and validate business requirements with stakeholders.
• Input to the design and implementation of solutions that support the business processes and deliver business insight.
• Liaise with management to coordinate process improvement project activities.
• Workshop facilitation with business stakeholders to map out processes and elicit business requirements.
• Practical Agile Delivery framework experience, developing Initiatives, Epics, User Stories and other documentation.
• Ability to work with the business to identify business process issues, improvement opportunities and potential solutions.
• Ability to gather, analyse and translate business data to meaningful insights.

Every application requires to address selection criteria as part of application submission.

Essential Criteria

1. Able to translate discussion into process flows, requirements and documentation.

2. Able to understand and capture business requirements relating to use / application of data to business problems.

3. Have experience in as is and to be process mapping.

4. Hands on experience with agile product development process for data products as well as developing detailed User Stories and UAC.

5. Intermediate skills with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, Powerpoint, Word.

6. Showcase good analytical and evaluating skills.

Desirable Criteria

1. Experience as a scrum master.

2. Experience creating wireframes.

3. Data analysis skills.

4. Experience working in data businesses.

Due to growth our federal government client is seeking a Data Product Owner to join their team based in Richmond or Geelong. You will be part of The Data and Analytics groups which supports the client by providing high quality data and reporting, and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions. The team develops, governs, and maintains an enterprise data warehouse and manages the clients’ reporting platforms and production content. It designs and builds Business Intelligence (BI) interventions and prototype analytic solutions and reports, identifying trends and drivers of performance.

Other Duties Will Be
• Contributing to the data strategy and product roadmap for key customer accounts. Respond and oversee customer needs, pain-points and opportunities, research and recommend opportunities for improvement.
• Using reporting and analysis tools and establish Data & Analytics capabilities to design, deliver and continually enhance data assets and products while leading the squad in product concept design and validation
• Maintaining, assembling, and prioritising a squad backlog, reflecting product roadmap activities and accommodating important and urgent ad hoc requests.
• Leading backlog planning, including story/requirements definition and effort estimation, with increasing resolution for nearer term work.

To apply for this opportunity, you will need the following:
• Be an Australian Citizen
• Hands on experience as a Product Owner.
• Experienced in agile product development process for data products.
• Experienced in developing product roadmaps.
• Able to understand complex business problems and translate into high level data solutions.
• Experience in developing, refining, and maintaining a product backlog prioritised on business value.
• Ability to effectively plan and manage resources to work on concurrent discovery, design and build activity for multiple product builds in parallel.
• Experience creating wireframes, visualising a solution is a bonus skill
• Data analysis skills is a bonus skill
• Experience working in data businesses and/or working as a scrum master is a bonus skill
• Hands on experience developing detailed User Stories and UAC is a bonus skill

Our client offers a 37.5 hour week with 3 days in the office and 2 days from home. For more information, please call Shelley on 0418 572 482 or email shelley.harrison@taleninternational.com

Contract length: 12 Months Contract + 3 x 1 Month (Pending approval)

Entry requirements: Australian Citizen + Ability to obtain Baseline

Pay range: $95.00 – 115.00 p/h inc super

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

Job Description

The Pepperstone story started in 2010. We know what it’s like to trade the world’s markets. Our team describes us as a place for the curious and the driven, and we like to do things a little differently; as a transformative global fintech, we’re digital, nimble, connected, and united in our vision to create a better way to trade.

We thrive on progress for our clients and for ourselves. Our organizational culture is ever-evolving, vibrant, diverse, global, and results focused. You’ll find our 350+ team currently across 9 locations and time zones.

The Role:

We are a data driven business and data is integral to everything we do. As we continue to evolve in this space, we are now looking for our newest member of our Data Analytics team. Our Data Analyst will be focused on designing, developing, automating, and updating reports that drive key business decisions, working closely with stakeholders across all areas of the business. Reporting to our Data Reporting Manager in Melbourne, you will make a tangible impact every day by ensuring our decision-makers have the information necessary to make strong decisions and achieve our strategic objectives. You'll do this by guiding them to existing dashboards, providing ad-hoc data sets, and creating new dashboards. You'll ensure the accuracy and consistency of information by cleaning, transforming, and delivering datasets to relevant platforms.

Our technology team is a dynamic force that thrives on inclusivity and collaboration, believing that diverse perspectives lead to groundbreaking solutions. We're not just about code; we're about people. We foster a culture that champions individual growth, professional development, and work-life harmony.

To thrive in this role, you'll have a passion for numbers and the ability to communicate them to a range of stakeholders. Your curiosity and passion for learning allow you to identify opportunities for improvement in the way we use data to facilitate decision-making.

As our Data Analyst, your key responsibilities include , but not limited to:
• Creating dashboards to facilitate effective day-to-day decision making by stakeholders
• Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements
• Helping to maintain data integrity through regular scrutiny of data and escalation of issues
• Driving improvements in communication and delivery of reports to management and stakeholders
• Directing stakeholders to the right reports/metrics to make informed decisions
• Documenting of reports and metrics
• Preparing of ad-hoc data requests

About You:
• 1-2 years’ of experience in a similar role with demonstrated experience with SQL
• Advanced skills in report generation using Tableau amp; Tableau Online
• Proven knowledge of and experience in Excel
• Analytical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills
• Demonstrated ability to meet multiple deadlines by prioritizing and managing time
• A desire for and dedication to ongoing learning and development
• Current and full working rights to be employed in Australia

Why you will enjoy working with us:
• Competitive salary structure including company bonus scheme
• Genuinely collaborative and friendly culture
• Flexible and hybrid working
• Remote working option - work from anywhere for up to 6 weeks per year, in addition to hybrid working as standard
• Ongoing personal development amp; learning opportunities
• 15 weeks paid primary carers parental leave amp; 4 weeks paid secondary carers leave
• 3 paid volunteering days per year amp; Workplace Giving Program
• Frequent events and celebrations including a standard weekly social
• Beautifully renovated large office at Collins Square - 727 Collins Street, Melbourne
• Best in class end of trip facilities including bicycle parking, change rooms amp; showers
• A full stocked kitchen, onsite coffee machines with locally sourced coffee beans (this is Melbourne after all) and curated specialty teas

More about Pepperstone

We’re a regulated online Forex and CFD trading platform. With the scale of a global fintech and the agility of a start-up, we arm our clients with everything they need to take on the global markets with confidence. You will be part of a wider passionate and friendly team, and whilst things may not always go to plan, we learn quickly and move forward with impact. To learn even more visit Pepperstonecareers.com and www.linkedin.com/company/pepperstone/

data.job_description:
About the role

Role Type: Permanent Full Time - multiple roles available

Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands - Melbourne

12 Months Fixed Term Contracts

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our customers so they can achieve incredible things– whether they’re buying a home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

As a Data Analyst, you deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insight, manage information, identify trends and make decisions. You will consult with stakeholders to understand business problems and collaborate with other data practitioners to design and deliver appropriate solutions.

What will your day look like?

To be successful in this role, you should bring in the following:
• Generate, monitor, present and analyse relevant customer insights, costs, benefits, and risks for customers, clients and cohorts; this could include business casing, what if scenarios and opportunity sizing & assessments, and development and maintenance of dashboards and visualisations
• Develop tools and methods to fully profile customers and customer segments
• Sourcing data from a variety of sources to combine, synthesise and analyse to generate insights
• Support key data platform and/or data scheduling jobs to support insights delivery to key audiences (e.g. frontline, other tribes)
• Contribute to the development of well-governed, shared and reusable data assets

What will you bring?

We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.

But back to some of the skills:
• Hands-on knowledge and experience with tools and techniques for analysis, data manipulation and presentation (e.g. SAS, SQL, Tableau, VBA, QlikSense)
• Good understanding of concepts in applied probability and statistics
• Experience with MarTech tools and campaign approaches
• Analytical and inquisitive mindset to continuously improve the level of insight surfaced
• Strong ability to translate data insights into practical business recommendations
