Company description:

The AFL is Australia's premier sporting organisation supporting two constantly evolving national competitions, AFL and AFLW. Our purpose is to progress the game, so everyone can share in its heritage and possibilities.
We have a strong workforce presence in most States and Territories of Australia including Northern Territory, QLD, NSW / ACT, Victoria and Tasmania.
As the AFL/ AFLW competitions continue to grow and evolve at both the elite and community levels, we are focused on ensuring we attract and retain great people in both permanent and casual roles at all levels and within all areas of our industry.
Importantly, we aim to reflect the communities where our game is played by recruiting locally where possible to strengthen our connection to the 'grassroots' of our game. We are also fortunate to have hundreds of passionate volunteers within our industry, offering their time and expertise to help grow our game.
The AFL's purchase of Marvel Stadium in Docklands, Melbourne, further diversifies our workforce with more than 1000 casual employees to make every moment matter for our fans and customers.
Job description:
ABOUT US
As an organisation, the AFL works tirelessly in all states and at all levels to enhance and grow the game - from grassroots to elite. Together, we put on the game, deliver important events, communicate with our fans, run community programs, develop coaches and umpires, collaborate with partners, delight members, support clubs and so much more. While our roles may vary, we are all united by a common goal, to progress the game so that everyone can share in its heritage and possibilities.
The AFL is committed to promoting and protecting the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in our care. Please note, we undertake several screening processes to ensure this commitment is upheld, this includes ensuring the successful candidate to this position holds a valid employee Working with Children/ Vulnerable People check and a satisfactory criminal history record check.
We are an Equal Opportunity employer and firmly believe that diversity and inclusion is an important part of both the AFL and the communities in which we operate. Our game is for everyone, and we strive to be a workplace for everyone.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.
ABOUT THE ROLE
Step into a trailblazing role with us as the guiding force of our AFL Digital Insights team. We are seeking a seasoned professional with a strong background in media, content or digital product analytics (especially GA-4 or Adobe Analytics). Your expertise will be the driving force in crafting a more engaging and personalised user experience across the AFL's digital platforms, setting a new benchmark for fan engagement in the AFL.
Reporting to the Head of Digital Products, you will be responsible for crafting actionable insights from multiple data sources, identifying trends, changes in fans' consumption patterns across our digital channels for the AFL, AFLW, AFL Clubs and Game Development. Some of the products we're responsible for include afl.com.au, AFLW site , all 18 Club websites, our mobile apps and the tipping and fantasy games. Your strategic input will be a cornerstone in amplifying audience growth, fostering a richer, one-on-one relationship with our fans utilising our new identity platform (AFL ID).
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF
Key Accountabilities:
Digital Product Insights Leadership:Navigate the analytical roadmap, focusing keenly on enhancing user experiences through product analytics and personalisation strategies. Take us from analytics in the aggregate to true insights into the journey of our users that we can report across the business.
Strategic Collaboration:Work closely with the in-house team of data analysts and engineers, to lead a productive conversation about adding our digital data to their Snowflake warehouse and create exciting actionable insights across different cohorts of user behaviour. If you're willing to learn, they're excited to talk to you about how we might use machine learning and predictive analytics within our products.
Data Visualisation and Strategy:Leverage tools like Tableau or Looker Studio to decode complex user journeys, developing clear metrics and behavioural patterns to guide data-driven decisions. You'll take a 'teach a person to fish' mentality and put the effort into allowing stakeholders to self-serve their most important data queries over time.
Team Development:Cultivate and nurture a vibrant team, fostering a culture of growth and learning. Support and coach a digital analyst to unleash their full potential.
Vendor and Stakeholder Management:Build solid relationships with third-party data agency partners, ensuring our data maturity ventures align with top-notch standards and future-focused goals.
Commercial Collaboration:Back the commercial team with strategic insights and data-driven proposals to enhance product and content performance. You'll gladly take responsibility for a 'video_view' GA-4 event being accurate, fired off at the right time and tested across different products.
Digital Product Collaboration:Work with Product Managers to inform roadmaps by designing accurate tagging and tracking of new product features as they're being built as well as iterating on existing features to ensure our data-layer is of a quality we're proud to build best-in-class personalised experiences from.

OUR IDEAL TEAM MEMBER
We are scouting for a leader who is a seasoned strategist, adept at steering the helm in the realms of digital product analytics and content personalisation. Your role will be pivotal in adopting a data-centric approach, where your insights will shape the digital narratives at the AFL.
You will expertly respond to business requests around reporting, benchmarking and forecasting across all platforms to measure content performance which may include audience reach and engagement on app, web or social. Alsoplease include a cover letter introducing yourself and what about this job appeals to you right now, what part of previous jobs reminds you of the key accountabilities above and why you want to come and work at the AFL.
Core Competencies:
Strategic Insight and Leadership: Proven experience in steering digital product analytics, providing deep insights into how a product is encountered by the end-user. A bonus if you have an interest towards personalisation and machine learning initiatives (I.e. how do we recommend a good bit of content to a fan?)
Analytical Prowess: Hands-on experience with tools such as Google Tag Manager, GA-4 or Adobe Analytics and Tableau, facilitating in-depth data analysis and visualisation. The ability to write a good query in SQL, Python or R - is a bonus.
Stakeholder Engagement:Proficient in cultivating relationships and communicating effectively with diverse stakeholders, acting as the linchpin for data-driven initiatives. Bonus if you have experience managing third-party data vendors, including research and digital agencies.
Continuous Learning and Team Growth:An advocate for learning and team development, nurturing a culture of innovation and growth within the team.
Professional Experience:5+ years in digital product analytics, with a focus on driving audience engagement and commercial outcomes. Bonus if it's in media, sports or content-related environments.

OUR CULTURE
Please visit
We are proudly a WORK180 endorsed employer for women, to see the great benefits that the AFL offers, please visit
THE PERKS
Play The Day Your Way- a flexible approach to your working life
My Development- lean into the AFL's My Development program consisting of on-the-job training, coaching and mentoring, and formal learning
Play Well- access to our extensive Health and Wellbeing program centered around our belief in a healthy body, healthy mind, and healthy workplace
My Benefits- with thanks to our AFL Corporate Partners, access great benefits and discounts
AFL Silver Memberships- permanent team members can access AFL matches at Marvel Stadium and the MCG, enjoy and share the experience of our game with your family and friends

data.job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you.

And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

What's in it for you?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities.

Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.

As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.

We are open to candidates located in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth or Canberra for this role.

What we're looking for
• Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.
• Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.
• Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.
• Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.
• Run human centred design sessions with end-users.
• Communicating and influencing stakeholders.
• Coaching non-data experts how to use data.

Skills and attributes for success
• Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.
• Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.
• Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.
• Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems : Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.

Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage. Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools ( Alteryx and Daraiku).

What we can offer you
• Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at
• Discover how, when and where you can work at
• Learn about our commitment to DE&I at
• Understand how our benefits can support you at

Acknowledgement of Country

EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders past, present, and emerging.

Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at

Apply now we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.

At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions.

We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process.

We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at om or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2).

Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.

EY Building a better working world

The Company

Robert Half are exclusively partnering with a leading Australian business who makes a real impact in their industry. Over the last 24 months, our client has been progressing through an effective and forward-thinking transformation program. They are looking to add to their impressive team to assist with the continuation of the successful transformation.

This well-respected organisation is focused on providing customers with an exceptional customer experience and employ a standout workforce to deliver.

The Role

Are you an experienced Reporting and Data Analyst, looking to join a dynamic team and play a critical role? We are looking for a self-motivated, strong communicator who can deal with ambiguity and establish structure to provide clarity.

Reporting into the CIO, as the Reporting and Data Analyst you will provide our client with actionable insights. The role will focus on collecting, processing, analysing and visualising data to support informed decision making. You will have the opportunity to collaborate across all levels of the business to better under the business direction, requirements and current capabilities to deliver reports to drive strategic initiatives.

Responsibilities will include:
• Develop new and improve existing Power BI reports and dashboards.

Your Preferred Skills & Experience

• Advanced Excel skills for data manipulation and analysis.

• Comfortable dealing with multiple stakeholders from different levels of the business.
• Demonstrated knowledge in data warehousing principles and methodologies.

About You

If you are a detailed, driven person with strong commercial acumen this is a perfect opportunity for you. You will play a pivotal role as the Reporting and Data Analyst and provide valuable data to drive strategic initiatives.

Don't miss the chance to be part of a dedicated team. Apply now to join the team and become a key player.

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Find out more about us at accenture.com.

Our team:

Accenture’s Data Engineering practice covers the range of Data and AI skills across all domains of data governance & quality, cloud & traditional data engineering and visual insights & next generation user interfaces. When combined with Accenture’s broader Strategy and Consulting and Technology businesses, we are able to bring together the unique end to end business changes through the application of Data and AI.

You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and where you can drive your career in new and exciting ways. Hungry for change and keen to level up, you will become an integral part of our Cloud First & Applied Intelligence team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on working with famous brands and household names – tackling some of the most challenging industry, community and national problems.

We are looking for hands-on authentic and committed Data Engineers to support clients across a range of industries.

Responsibilities will include all aspects of data engineering from delivery planning, estimating and analysis, all the way through to data architecture and pipeline design, delivery and production implementation

You will be working on client projects with teams from across our Applied Intelligence practice as well as industry, functional, and technology SMEs on some of our clients most challenging projects

You will be designing and implementing complex data solutions ranging from batch to streaming and event-driven architectures, across cloud, on-premise, and hybrid client technology landscapes

Additionally, you will be helping translate data to insights that enable the business to make decisions as well as using visualisations to tell a compelling story with data that makes complex topics understandable

Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

We are looking for experience a number in the following skills:

3+ years of experience in data engineering in a customer or business facing capacity

Ability to understand and articulate requirements to technical and non-technical audiences

Stakeholder management and communication skills, including prioritising, problem solving and interpersonal relationship building

Strong experience in SDLC delivery, including waterfall, hybrid and Agile methodologies. Experience delivering in an agile environment,

Experience of implementing and delivering data solutions and pipelines on Azure cloud platforms

A strong understanding of data modelling, data structures, databases, and ETL processes

An in-depth understanding of large-scale data sets, including both structured and unstructured data

Strong SQL and/or Python knowledge

Experience with related/complementary open source software platforms and languages (e.g. Java, Linux, Apache, Perl/Python/PHP, Chef)

Knowledge and experience of delivering CI/CD and DevOps capabilities in a data environment

Salary range: 70,000 to 85,000 AUD

IQ Group

IQ Group has supported Superannuation and Wealth Management clients through unprecedented change for more than 15 years in Australia. From our offices in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane, over 90 specialist consultants assist clients improve their operations and use of technology. Our clients benefit from IQ Group's domain experience and commitment to project delivery. IQ Group is part of a global company with other offices in South Africa.

The Opportunity

IQ Group is undergoing an exciting period of growth, and have been engaged as the partner of choice to deliver a number of strategic programs on behalf of our customers.

In order to be a successful candidate for this position, we do require an experienced Data Analyst. You will ideally have solid experience setting up SQL queries across a number of data sources to automatically detect and manage data quality exceptions in the Financial Services Industry

Skills required (non negotiable):
• Min 3-5 yrs proven experience as a Data Analyst
• Advanced SQL Scripting
• SQL Server - For Extract, Transform & Load
• Advanced Excel for building reports
• Superannuation & or Financial Services experience
Why IQ Group?
Our purpose is to nurture and support a team who share our passion for delivering solutions that accelerate change and improve our clients' business results. As an IQ Group Consultant, you will have the chance to make an impact in the development of complex solutions for a wide range of organizations whilst working alongside and learning from other knowledgeable and experienced consultants. You may also have the opportunity to travel interstate and collaborate with your interstate colleagues.

If you're keen to join a dynamic and progressive organisation on the forefront of the financial services sector please apply now.

Melbourne, Australia
• Be part of a growing technology team in the middle of a digital transformation
• Join a fun place where people look forward to coming to work every day but also offer the flexibility to determine your own work-from-home schedule too!

Our Company

We are now the global leader in industry market research with a very loyal following of the world’s elite businesses we want to build relationships with at scale. How did we come to be a global leader? It’s all about our people…and we are looking to add even more talented people to our growing technology team.

IBISWorld is a place where we love coming to work every day, but also offers flexible working arrangements because we know work-life balance is important to make you successful. Do you want an environment where decisions are made together? Are you looking to play an integral role in the data and technology functions of a company?

At IBISWorld, our people are our most important asset. Our offices are filled with professionals who work hard for our clients, and also love to have fun. We promote a supportive and collaborative environment where management is invested in your development and growth. Be part of a technology and data team that can influence the way we think about and develop our products.

Job Overview

IBISWorld Data Analysts sit within the broader Data Team, while working closely with local Research teams. Data Analysts are responsible for supporting Data, Product, and Product Development teams to expand and optimize our library of structured data that feeds IBISWorld’s products. A successful Data Analyst is an experienced data wrangler who enjoys working with large datasets, particularly public data sources that form the basis of IBISWorld’s products.

IBISWorld’s data team sits at the heart of product development, within IBISWorld’s product and IT teams, responsible for providing our 100,000+ customers with data and insights on over 10,000 industries globally.

This position works cross-functionally with the Research, Product Development, and IT teams across a range of projects and technologies, so strong communication and collaborative skills are must.

Key Duties
• Act as a subject-matter expert on local data sources used in IBISWorld’s products, with a particularly strong working knowledge of government data sets. Research and test underutilized data sets that can be used in IBISWorld’s products.
• Support Data Engineers to navigate local data sources, understand data anomalies, and answer questions about mapping data sources to IBISWorld data structures.
• Provide technical specifications, documentation and requirements to Data Engineers to transform raw source data into data structured to support IBISWorld’s products.
• Outline test cases during initial specifications to check for data errors and anomalies that ensure complete data sets. Work directly with Data Engineers on testing data to meet specifications.
• Work with Senior Data Analyst(s) to oversee IBISWorld’s proprietary models, including our Risk model and forecasting models.
• Work with other local data analysts, data engineers, and management to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies to increase data integrity.
• Use automated tools to extract and clean data from primary and secondary sources.

As a Successful Candidate, You Will Have
• Strong mathematical skills to collect, measure, organize, and analyze data. Strong knowledge of data analysis principals, such as applied techniques (statistics, econometrics, data analytics, etc)
• Good understanding of and competence in aligning data techniques with client requirements.
• Familiarity with economic, financial, or demographic data and experience with modelling within Excel, R or Python.
• Basic-to-intermediate experience with programming languages such as SQL, R, and Python to analyse large data sets. While experience is not a prerequisite for this role, you must have a strong desire to build skills in this area.
• Basic understanding of database design and data models.

Other Skills
• Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; commercial mindset
• Exceptional organizational skills, with the ability to manage and prioritize various responsibilities and consistently meet deadlines. Flexibility to effectively deal with unexpected assignments, changes to workload or design revisions mid-project based on management priorities or client requests
• Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, especially with stakeholders who often have limited technical knowledge
• Ability to work with others, as well as independently and autonomously with minimal supervision

Benefits
• Flexible working hours and hybrid working arrangements
• Professional development and training
• Weekly Friday afternoon company-wide meetups
• Employee benefits and rewards via free breakfast, fruit, and the Perkbox app
• Subsidized gym membership at the Grand Hyatt City Club

You will be rewarded with a competitive salary + super, work from home days as well as a great working environment.

If you think you are the ideal candidate for this role please apply by submitting your resume and a short cover letter. If you would like to know more about IBISWorld please visit our Careers Page (www.ibisworld.com/careers).

IBISWorld is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants must be authorised for employment in Australia.

About CPBJH JV

CPBJH JV brings together two of Australia's leading construction partners, CPB Contractors and John Holland, with unparalleled expertise in large-scale and complex project management, civil construction, traffic management and tunnelling.

The West Gate Tunnel is a partnership between the Victorian Government and Transurban. The Joint Venture has been chosen as the contractor for construction, which began in early 2018 following planning assessment.

About the Project

The West Gate Tunnel Project is a city-shaping project that will deliver a vital alternative to the West Gate Bridge, provide quicker and safer journeys, and remove thousands of trucks off residential streets. The project will include:
• Widening the West Gate Freeway from eight lanes to 12 between the M80 Ring Road and Williamstown Road;
• Building a 2.8km eastbound tunnel and a 4km westbound tunnel under Yarraville;
• Constructing a bridge over the Maribyrnong River providing an alternative to the West Gate Bridge;
• Constructing an elevated road along Footscray Road to the Port of Melbourne;
• Major new cycling and pedestrian paths.

• Embedding flexible work practices

• Actively looking to attract and promote women into non- traditional roles and putting support structures in place to help them succeed.

Req ID: 50731

Department: Product and Well Managed Cluster

Division: Australia Retail

Location: Melbourne

About the role

Role Type: Permanent Full Time - multiple roles available

Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands - Melbourne

12 Months Fixed Term Contracts

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our customers so they can achieve incredible things– whether they’re buying a home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

As a Data Analyst, you deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insight, manage information, identify trends and make decisions. You will consult with stakeholders to understand business problems and collaborate with other data practitioners to design and deliver appropriate solutions.

What will your day look like?

To be successful in this role, you should bring in the following:

Generate, monitor, present and analyse relevant customer insights, costs, benefits, and risks for customers, clients and cohorts; this could include business casing, what if scenarios and opportunity sizing & assessments, and development and maintenance of dashboards and visualisations

Develop tools and methods to fully profile customers and customer segments

Sourcing data from a variety of sources to combine, synthesise and analyse to generate insights

Support key data platform and/or data scheduling jobs to support insights delivery to key audiences (e.g. frontline, other tribes)

Contribute to the development of well-governed, shared and reusable data assets

What will you bring?

We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.

But back to some of the skills:

Hands-on knowledge and experience with tools and techniques for analysis, data manipulation and presentation (e.g. SAS, SQL, Tableau, VBA, QlikSense)

Good understanding of concepts in applied probability and statistics

Experience with MarTech tools and campaign approaches

Analytical and inquisitive mindset to continuously improve the level of insight surfaced

Strong ability to translate data insights into practical business recommendations

Strong data visualisation skills

Ability to effectively communicate to all stakeholders (technical and non-technical)

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So, why join us?

There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.

But it’s not just our customers who’ll feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.

We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements.

You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 50731.

To be successful in this role, you must have exceptional technical skills and a passion for data-driven decision making.The successful candidate will have a degree in a quantitative field, such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, and a minimum of 4 years of experience in data analysis. In addition, you will be expected to bring a deep understanding of data analysis principles, methods, and tools. You must also possess the ability to communicate complex data in an easy-to-understand manner, both verbally and in writing.We’re looking for someone with a positive attitude and a desire to take on new challenges. If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we’d love to hear from you.

Develop and implement data analysis and reporting strategies
Use data visualization and reporting tools to communicate data findings

Vanguard is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

data.job_description:
Good call. We’re an exciting new digital enterprise with big ideas, supporting some of Australia’s most trusted and iconic brands focussed on making lives better for people all around Australia. We’re well on our way towards bringing the best of digital and data possibilities together to create more personalised shopping experiences for customers across our retail brands. Why? Because we want to make life more effortless for all Australians.

We’re continuing to bring the best talent and skills under one roof, working together and across disciplines to build amazing experiences for our customers. We continuously feed off each other’s insights, talents and capabilities, because we are a business that thrives on open collaboration and a shared vision of positive, fun and rewarding experiences.

In this role, you'll get to
• Identify the key actionable insights through the analysis of data and translate this into clear business relevant recommendations and presentations.
• Showcase, benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics-based decision making.
• Apply appropriate analytical methods and techniques in an agile, pragmatic way that reflects the needs, constraints and KPIs of the business (e.g. time, cost, quality, data availability).
• Serve as a trusted advisor by cultivating relationships with stakeholders and across various Leadership teams to deliver ad-hoc insights and by building repeatable reports and so the value from becoming a data driven organisation.
• Contribute to the direction, development and implementation of the data and analytics strategy, roadmap and knowledge base within OneDigital and broader analytics teams within Wesfarmers divisions.

Relationship & KPIs
• Collaborate with stakeholders in Analytics, Digital / Ecommerce, Marketing, Commercial, Technology, Data Engineering and Data Science teams to deliver valuable solutions to key business problems.
• Serve as a trusted advisor by cultivating relationships with stakeholders to improve their understanding and knowledge of analytical techniques and outcomes.
• Effective communication with key stakeholders around the delivery of key projects.

Delivery
• Design and implement new analytics solutions, to meet business needs.

Innovation
• Source, develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques.

To shine on day one, what you need to have:
• Analytics professional with a proven track record (1-2 years) in the development and business use of digital analytics technology and working with large & complex data sets.
• Track record in designing and delivering data driven and/or analytics solutions that are actionable.
• Proficiency in SQL and digital analytics (e.g. Google BigQuery, Tealium).
• Ability to engage and influence business users in the opportunity and benefit from data driven decisions.

It's a bonus, but not required, if you have:
• Experience with BI visualisation tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau).
• Experience with Python.
• Experience in big data analytics and technology.
• Proficiency in DAX and Power Query.
• Familiarity with web architecture including tag management, data layers, analytics tracking, and corresponding data flows.

Why OneDigital?
• Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things.
• You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life.
• Culture of comradery and collaboration - OneTeam
• Plus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed.
• We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.

Team Benefits – just to name a few!

To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include:
• Access to the latest technologies.
• An annual budget for your learning and development (this includes learning of your choice, certifications and more).
• Extended parental leave (16 weeks for primary carers), and paid volunteer days.
• Flexible working – we balance working together with working flexibly
• People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small
• Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards.

Next steps

If this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date. For brief enquiries please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner at sprasad@wesdigital.com.au

Company Description

We are a customer-obsessed, “one stop shop” for all things data-related. We are deliberately narrow in our focus areas but we go deep in each of them. We provide solutions, services and training in the data strategy, data governance, data security, data management, data classification, data wrangling, data lake, data analytics, data visualisation, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT areas. Our solutions and services help transform customer organisations by teaching them how to turn their data into insight

We build on AWS, using the latest AWS services, best practices and reference architectures. We deliberately focus on large public sector customers that are data-heavy but insight-light – federal & state government departments, universities, public sector agencies, public health organisations, and public utilities.

We are an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner and an AWS Public Sector Partner, working towards our Data & Analytics and Government competencies. We are also a registered technology supplier to the Federal, New South Wales, Victorian and Western Australian governments and we have a Master Services Agreement in place with AWS Professional Services.

Job Description

Your impact

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in working with customers to understand their business requirements, map these to their data capabilities, liaise with our internal Data Engineers to design and build elegant solutions, then partner with our customers to deploy those solutions in a way that allows them to turn data into insight. You will have 2-3 years’ experience working as a Data Analyst (or similar role) on data-related solutions, preferably using AWS, and will be comfortable working with business analysts, data visualisers, data engineers and data scientists, to enable customers to solve their data-related challenges.

You will relish the opportunity to innovate, evolve and challenge existing assumptions and to develop the data-related requirements that feed into the design of solutions that solve real-world problems for customers. Your experience with large-scale data challenges and ability to analyse them as input into reliable, scalable cloud-based solutions, will see you thriving in this role!

Expectations
• Enjoy honing your data-related analysis skills and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to solution discussions.
• Regularly take part in further education and training to help you hone and extend your data analysis skills.
• Have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about solutions to business, product, and technical challenges.
• Possess an innate awareness of technology trends and how they impact the way businesses consume IT.
• Strong Analytics skills to collect, analyze and generate insight using data.
• Have a basic understanding of IT security and governance including security standards, access policies, and data classification schema.
• Love what you do and instinctively know how to make work fun.
• Be dynamic, creative, and willing to take on challenges that have the potential to make a big impact.
• Relish a ground floor opportunity to work in a small, agile, friendly startup environment.
• A Graduate degree (or Masters) in a data or technology-related discipline is preferred.
• An AWS Associate Solutions Architect certification is a bonus.

Qualifications

Technical Requirements:

2+ years of:

o Hands on, practical experience, in and around data-related solutions

o AWS experience

o A basic understanding of software development tools and methodologies

o Data analysis experience

o Experience producing quality documentation and written communications

· Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Bitbucket, Bamboo, Jenkins or Ansible

· Some experience with both writing and interpreting SQL queries.

· Experience building reports and dashboards using BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI or Amazon QuickSight.

· A basic understanding of Infrastructure as Code, especially AWS Cloudformation.

· Some programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, Java, Node.js, .Net, PHP.

· A basic understanding of data ingestion and transformation pipelines.

· A basic understanding of fundamental data concepts including databases, data schema, data classification, data security, data governance, data analysis, data transformation, data engineering and data science.

· A basic understanding of fundamental networking concepts.

Additional Information
• We’re passionate about the technical community we are a part of, and believe in contributing to open source and AWS initiatives
• We care about climate change and are always looking at ways to reduce our carbon footprint
• We support and contribute to a different cause each quarter
• We’re committed to developing your career with customised individual growth and development plans
• We’re committed to ensuring all our staff feel welcome, included and respected every day they work for The Data Foundry

Full Job Description
ACCIONA is a global company, leading in the development of regenerative infrastructure that creates a positive impact on society. Our workforce consists of more than 45,500 professionals, present in more than 40 countries across the five continents, all contributing in our mission to design a better planet. Are you a passionate individual who wants to make a difference, promote sustainable development, and find solutions to the biggest global challenges including climate change, overpopulation, and water scarcity? Come and join us in building the infrastructure our planet needs to achieve a sustainable future.

Job Description

Benefits

Personalised career progression plans to help you achieve your goals

Join a market leader in sustainability and help build a better world for all

Support a major civil infrastructure project - The North East Link

Competitive salary in line with experience + Acciona Bonus Incentive Scheme + Salary Sacrifice/Novated Leasing

The Opportunity

Due to our Acciona, MACA, AECOM (AMA) Alliance being selected as the preferred proponent on the Ring Road Completion Project we are seeking to appoint a Data Science Analyst working out of the Collingwood project office.

The Project

This package of works covers the design and construction of the North East Link between the M80 - Plenty Rd interchange, and the north tunnel entrance at Watsonia. Works include three kilometres of new freeway, two kilometres of freeway upgrades, construction of retaining walls and bridge structures, rail interface works, intelligent transport systems, and urban design and landscaping. This diverse and challenging project will be complete in 2028.

Key accountabilities for the position

Work with stakeholders to identify and understand their reporting needs.

Collect and manipulate large amounts of data from data lakes using SQL and other data management tools.

Design and develop interactive reports using Power BI.

Ensure reports and dashboards are accurate, accessible, and visually appealing.

Monitor Power BI workspace and ensure automatic report refreshes / maintenance and report distribution within the project team.

Provide training and support to end-users on how to effectively use the reports and dashboards.

Collaborate with data science team to integrate reporting with other data analysis and visualization tools.

Stay up-to-date with latest trends and developments in data reporting and visualization.

Required Skills and Competencies

Passion for data science and data reporting, with experience and track record in delivering data reporting outcomes on projects

Understanding of digital engineering within survey, design construction and asset delivery

Excellent interpersonal skills, with experience and the ability to influence and guide stakeholders

Ability to build and maintain relationships, being the interface between the key stakeholders within the Alliance

Catholic Education Commission of Victoria
About Catholic Education Commission of Victoria (CECV)
CECV is the peak body for Catholic education in Victoria.

Established in 1973 by the Archbishop of Melbourne and the Bishops of the Ballarat, Sale, and Sandhurst dioceses, it was incorporated in 2006 and acts as the voice of Catholic education in State and national matters.

CECV receives and distributes funding from state and federal governments for Catholic schools, provides strategic leadership and planning, and ensures proper governance in Catholic education statewide.

It is responsible for sector leadership in education integrity and governance and has a Memorandum of Understanding to act as a Review Body for Catholic schools with the Victorian Registration and Qualifications Authority (VRQA).

As a Review Body, CECV supports, reviews, and monitors the compliance of Catholic schools with all registration, reporting and other requirements under relevant laws.

CECV is currently engaged in a significant organisational redesign, the overriding objective of which is to establish a robust and sustainable CECV for the future.
Why work with us

As the peak body for Catholic education in Victoria, CECV provides employees an opportunity to help shape the future of Catholic education across the state.

The renewed CECV will offer flexible working, a central city office location, competitive remuneration with generous benefits (including salary sacrifice options), and opportunities for career development and progression.
These benefits combine with our commitment to work life balance to make CECV an employer of choice.
About the role

The Research, Policy and Performance Excellence team undertakes a range of functions in support of the CECV's strategic leadership role.

It analyses data on school and system performance, oversees or undertakes strategic research, coordinates policy development and submissions to government and regulatory agencies, and leads other strategic initiatives to shape the direction of Catholic education in Victoria.
The Senior Analyst, Data and Insights will lead collection, analysis and reporting on data, creating valuable insights for CECV. They will also play a critical role in shaping CECV's data governance practices and capabilities.
Key responsibilities of the role

Analysis and reporting of key statewide datasets (NAPLAN, VCE, VET, enrolments, school funding data, etc.) to various internal stakeholders, including the CECV Board, CECV leadership and school governing authorities.
Collection and analysis of other data relevant to Catholic education in Victoria (e.g. data of Census of Population and Housing, data collected through surveys) in support of various CECV research, advocacy and performance assessment activities.
Provide assistance, as necessary, to school governing authorities on data collection, analysis and reporting.
Assist in the development and operation of data-sharing arrangements across school governing authorities.
Assist in the development of CECV's data governance policies and procedures.
Support data literacy and data governance capabilities across CECV.
Support the development of CECV reports and publications requiring data analysis and reporting.

Development of Power BI reports for various audiences within the CECV and Catholic education, to support data analysis and data literacy.
Complete ad hoc data requests as required by CECV leadership and the wider Research, Policy and Performance Excellence team.
Support the Manager, Research, Policy and Performance Excellence and Chief Strategy Officer with relevant projects.
Key selection criteria
Demonstrated experience in data collection, analysis and reporting.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to analyse data to provide insight on critical issues facing an organisation.
Advanced skills in Microsoft office applications, including Excel, Powerpoint and Power BI.
Well-developed interpersonal skills, with experience in engaging and collaborating with a range of stakeholders.
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to present complex information with clarity and confidence.
Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver outputs in a timely manner.
Skills, qualifications, and pre-requisites
Relevant tertiary qualification.
Minimum of 3 years' experience in a similar strategy, business intelligence, or data analytics role.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Master Data Analyst to join our IT team. With the option of being based at either our Derrimut or Colac site, you will work closely with the Business Process experts to ensure data quality, compliance and operating procedures are adhered to with relation to Master Data management. Additionally, you will provide support by monitoring and analysing master data, key data, and master relationship data within the organization.

Your key responsibilities will include:
• Managing master data in SAP and other systems.
• Work closely with the business to ensure alignment of master data rules and procedures
• Ensure the high quality of master data in key systems as well as maintaining the processes to support the data quality
• Identify areas for data quality improvements and help resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies
• In collaboration with subject matter experts and data owners, define and implement data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.
• Manage, analyse, and resolve data issues and manage revisions needed to best meet internal and customer requirements while adhering to Bulla data standards
• Assist in the creation and implementation of data standards and guidelines on data ownership, coding structures, and data replication to ensure access to and integrity of data
• Conduct data cleaning activities for better management and quicker access

To be successful in this role, you will be degree qualified in Business or IT and have a minimum of 2 years' experience in managing Material Master Data in SAP.

You will have:
• A demonstrated understanding of data analysis and validation techniques in SAP environment
• Attention to detail and accuracy in managing data in the system
• Ability to create supporting documentation including (Master Data process documents, Data Standard Documents, Data flow diagrams etc.)
• Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment and use team work to resolve problems and issues within and outside of our direct accountabilities
• Strong attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills
• Strong communication skills (written, verbal & interpersonal)
• Strong stakeholder management skills
• Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
• FMCG and dairy industry experience would also be highly regarded.

What we can offer you!
• Great cultural environment in a proud, Australian family-owned business
• A variety of benefits including a Short-Term Incentive Program, corporate clothing, delicious take-home product allowance, and free on-site parking at all our sites
• Ability to work remotely in line with the needs of the role

This is a unique opportunity to truly make your mark & contribute to the success of the iconic Bulla Dairy Foods brand. If you think you have the ability to successfully drive improvement in an SAP environment, please apply now to join our team!

From aged care homes receptionists, dental surgeons, telehealth and admin, to our call centres, data professionals and tech gurus, we’re all in it together – 22,000+ people who keep inspiring each other to explore new possibilities, wherever the challenges of the healthcare world take us.

Where are we heading?
We set a global ambition to be the world's most customer-centric healthcare company, and are committed to excellent customer experiences through service, value, and putting our customer at the heart of everything we do. Care is at our core and will always be a part of how we operate.
More than that, our care puts customers at the heart of everything we do. We make a genuine effort to see the world through our customers’ eyes to make things easy, keep relevant to their needs and showing empathy and understanding.

Reporting to the Head of Channel Analytics, this role is responsible for the development, maintenance and enhancement of our Customer and Business Operation (CBO) team’s data visualisation and reporting facilitation. This role is instrumental in engaging with key business partners and CBO management to arrive at sustainable solutions that support data-driven decisioning.

This role requires you to collate data from various available sources, to then conduct data synthesis using available tools to provide comprehensive details and understandings of operational efficiencies.

This is a 6-month fixed term, full-time role that can be based nationwide in Australia.

How will I help?
Key accountabilities of this role include:
• Manage a suite of Power BI dashboards designed to support business leaders with channel operations.
• Continuous improvement of how these reports are fed into from existing technologies and data structures, spanning contact centre, retail, digital messaging, customer advocacy, claims processing, and any other arising business areas within the remit of CBO
• Work with the Data Ops and Data Science Leads to integrate automation across relevant metrics into visualisations that assist in decision making

• Other data visualisation or reporting work as required for Customer & Business Operations leadership
• Overlaying business and process understanding across contact centre operations or customer facing environment

What do I need?
• Business relevant qualification (e.g. Data, Finance, Engineering, Science, Management, etc.)
• Experience in Power BI, with familiarity in SAS/SQL preferred
• Understanding of Power BI functionalities
• Proven ability to analyse data and present granular or technical data in an effective and reliable manner.
• Establishes good relationships to people at all levels
• Ability to proactively engage and collaborate with stakeholders across the organisational structure.
• Focuses on stakeholder needs and satisfaction, setting high standards for quality and quantity
• Manages time effectively to meet deadlines and milestones.
• Works productively in a pressurised environment, keeping emotions under control during difficult situations and balances the demands of work by maintaining a positive outlook at work.

Why work at Bupa?
• We reward our people and celebrate their success, provide initiatives that develop careers and look after our people’s health, well-being, and futures.
• We’re a welcoming lot, no matter who you are or where you’ve come from. We welcome all talents and backgrounds and embrace our differences, so you can bring your true self to work.
• Our employees can access wide range of benefits: from our own products (incl. health insurance discounts) to many other products and services via our partnerships program (like Apple, Samsung, JB Hi-Fi, plus gym and spa discounts to name a few).

This is a specialist role for a Senior + (Senior, Staff or Principal) Data Scientist who has experience deploying, feature engineering and building data requirements with MMM (Marketing/Media Mix Models) in markets outside of Australia.

You will spearhead the global expansion of our model outside of Australia into global markets.

You'll work alongside our growing team of amazing Data Scientists, learning state of the art Bayesian and Time Series techniques.

This role can be based in Sydney or Melbourne where we have offices in both cities and have a hybrid way of working.

The role

You'll be responsible for levelling up our efficiency and process, working alongside our Data Science and Marketing Science teams to make sure we institutionalise and automate our process to handle different global markets.

Then you will also contribute to the design of our generalised model with our RnD team, proactively designing solutions for issues that may arise in new markets and capturing each market’s uniqueness in data.

What we are looking for

It's a short but simple list of requirements we're looking for in this position:

1 + years Experience conducting MMM with a global provider outside of AU as a Data Scientist.

That paired with strong Data Science fundamentals, so you'll be at a Senior level as well.

You don't have to have built the MMM model but we are looking for someone who has been part of an international MMM process; deploying, feature engineering and defining data requirements.

About Mutinex

We might be an early stage startup but we already have strong product market fit, household name clients (Samsung, Mars, CUB and ING to name a few) and millions in revenue.

Being early stage means we're also still pretty scrappy and you wouldn't be coming into a well oiled machine, yet. But you would get a lot of opportunity to design, build and oil the machine until it's super oily.

We aren't aiming to be another Tech Unicorn because Unicorns aren't real. We are aiming (and confident of being) more like a real and really big animal that lives for a long time, like a Bowhead Whale.

Equity is on offer on top of base salary and super with amazing growth potential and more benefits to come as we build out our offering.

Mutinex is a startup B2B SaaS platform that provides in-depth data analytics for marketers to better understand their ROI and make better decisions with future spend.

Founded in Australia and with recent seed capital ($5 million, backed by EVP) we are growing our team to continue to improve our product, bring in new customers and enable them to make better and more informed decisions.

We have a hybrid work environment with no set or minimum days in the office and with teams in Sydney, Melbourne and expanding into the US.

With a team of around 45 people we value high quality communication, strong opinions that are held loosely and people who can give and take feedback well.

Mutinex focuses on SaaS, Advertising, Sales and Marketing, Machine Learning, and Big Data. Their company has offices in Melbourne and Sydney. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Mutinex has raised $5M of funding; their latest round was closed on March 2023 at a valuation of $37M.

You can view their website at https://mutinex.co/ or find them on LinkedIn.

About ViVi

Vivi is the only wireless screen mirroring and digital signage tool designed for education. We enable K-12 organizations to realize more value from their existing investments in display technology and student devices, by providing more consistent and reliable experiences for students, teachers and staff to connect, communicate and collaborate.

Vivi exists because we all had that one teacher who changed our lives, who went above and beyond to serve as a role model and sage. They guided discussion, connected with their students on a personal level, were just as engaging and entertaining as they were educational, and they created a dynamic learning environment by constantly involving students.

Personalized learning environments have been proven to deliver better educational outcomes for individuals through increased participation and engagement. To successfully create such an environment requires a fluid, visual dialogue between teacher and student. This is why Vivi exists. 

Vivi is used by over 500,000 teachers and students in more than 90,000 classrooms around the world and is setting out to disrupt the enormous education industry with our high-growth, ambitious, and creative team.

What You’ll Be Doing
• Building and maintaining production level data pipelines using various tools such as AWS Glue, Python, Lambda etc. that populate business critical dashboards as needed
• Performing data analysis as required, and promptly preparing reports with the findings/results
• Building custom analyses, reports, dashboards using tools in Vivi’s BI stack
• Building/maintaining components of the Data Warehouse as per the Architecture using CI/CD
• Implementing the BI Data Quality Framework
• Supporting the business stakeholders with ad hoc BI and data requests
• Working with internal customers, Engineering, Product and support teams to prioritise requests and reports
• Identifying opportunities to establish/improve the processes and practices
• Creating relevant documentation as required

About You
• You have 2-5 years’ experience in a similar role, working on cloud data pipelines
• Knowledge of AWS or Azure Cloud technologies
• Knowledge of the following would be ideal – Power BI, Python, SQL, Postgres, Excel
• Excellent analytical skills
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Excellent documentation skills
• Exposure to the Atlassian suite of tools, e.g. Jira and Confluence
• Exposure to agile working practices
• Comfortable in a fast-paced start-up environment

What We Can Offer You
• Career progression – we offer each employee an annual $1000 L&D budget to assist with furthering their skills
• Wellness program – including wellness days off and subsidised ClassPass subscription
• Give back to the community with our Volunteer program
• Birthdays off each year

Company Description

illion is the leading independent provider of trusted data and analytics products and services in Australia and New Zealand. illion leverages its consumer and commercial credit registries to provide end-to-end customer management solutions to clients in the financial services, telecommunications, utilities and government sectors.

Job Description

Your new role and how you’ll make a difference

Are you ready for your next career move in finance and want autonomy and freedom to develop your experience quickly across all areas of the P&L.

FP&A at illion operates through an integrated business partner approach, working with the business to provide commercial insight into historical and future results that will enable the management team to make better business decisions. This is done through closely collaborating with business partners to understand the core drivers of business performance and develop relevant metrics and timely reports that measure, monitor and report on performance.

This key role within finance will also work with financial and non-financial systems (e.g. TM1, Great Plains, Salesforce and proprietary systems) to create integrated KPI and finance reporting for management and the board. You will need to be willing to get your hands dirty in systems interrogation and report building to be successful.

The value-add things you’ll be doing
• Support the Head of FP&A and GM Finance by working with key stakeholders to understand key business drivers of sales, revenue and opex and use this knowledge to identify future opportunities and issues so that appropriate action can be taken in advance
• Identify trends and model future impacts and outcomes
• Ad-hoc financial analysis where required
• KPI reporting and interpretation as leading and lagging indicators of financial performance
• Sales and Revenue reporting by Customer & Product
• Assist the business to understand and interpret the financial information in the system and reports to enable management to plan, evaluate, control and enhance performance of their areas of responsibility in the business.
• Support the business in the use of the system through developing relevant, system driven dashboard and management accounting reports that can be readily accessed and understood by the business managers.
• Preparation of the monthly management pack.

Qualifications

The experience and qualifications you’ll need to be successful
• Cognos TM1 experience highly regarded
• Budgeting & Forecasting Experience
• Great Plains Experience
• Salesforce.com experience
• Budgeting & Forecasting Experience
• Sales and technology business partnering
• 2+ years business partnering/finance experience with exposure to planning and forecasting
• CPA, CA or equivalent
• Cognos TM1 experience or similar highly regarded
• Able to explain complex finance concepts and data in simple, commercial terms
• Advanced excel skills including financial modelling
• Ability to analyse large data sets and translate the data into meaningful messages, action items and communications (verbal, written and numerical)

Additional Information

Some of our perks
• Flexibility and Remote Working Options
• Gifted Leave, Purchased Leave, Public Holiday Swap and Paid Volunteer Leave
• Paid Parental Leave
• Novated Leasing and Corporate Discounts (ie. Health Insurance)
• Education Assistance and dedicated time for professional development as part of your role
• Free Employee Assistance Programme, Free Flu Shots and Subsidised Gym Memberships.

As the Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the development and delivery of the end-to-end data migration process in collaboration with a multi-disciplined team of technical and non-technical stakeholders. Use business intelligence tools to identify, collate, consolidate, transform and store sources of data for migration.

Previous experience with CMS optimisation and data migration.
Strong and effective written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate complex technical concepts, issues, and terms to a range of non-technical stakeholders.
Proven high level critical thinking and analytical skills including ability to propose solutions to complex problems.

Description

IT Data Manager

We are looking for an experienced IT Data Manager to join our team in Scoresby, Melbourne.

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:
• Define the Data Strategy for a large organisation moving to S/4 HANA.
• Represent the project team in enterprise data governance council and master data management forums.
• Extract insights from data by identifying relationships and patterns. Using a suite of data exploration and data visualization techniques (such as Predictive and Statistical Modelling) to understand the underlying structure of the data and enable sound conclusions upon model building.
• Partner with data engineers on building data infrastructure & data scientists for analytical / machine learning models to generate predictive insights used in solving business questions.
• Provides expertise and leadership, coaching and direction of data analysts across the organization.
• Lead data cleansing, archiving, validation, transformation, and migration of data from legacy ERP to SAP.

To be successful in this role you will need the following:
• Degree qualified in IT, data analytics or a relevant field.
• At least seven years’ experience in Data Management and Big Data Analytics.
• Experience in SAP data migration and data models.
• Experience in S/4HANA Embedded Analytics preferred.
• Experience working in a large complex organisation.

• Hybrid Working Model & Free Onsite Parking
• Comprehensive Cummins product training provided
• Income Protection continuance insurance
• Discounts with select private health insurance, PC software/hardware and a range of vehicles
• Annual remuneration review
• Participation in an annual variable compensation (bonus) program
• Employee Assistance Program available to employees
• Paid Parental leave (Conditions apply)
